name: Centre Georges-Pompidou
description: 20th-century modern art museum, hosting the Paris Museum of Modern Art

name: Cité des Sciences et de l'Industrie
description: a hands-on science museum that attracts over two million visitors yearly

name: The Louvre
description: one of the world's largest museums and a historic monument

name: Musée des Arts et Métiers
description: Museum of Arts and Crafts that houses the collection of the Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers (National Conservatory of Arts and Industry), which was founded in 1794 as a repository for the preservation of scientific instruments and inventions

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: 19th-century paintings, one of the largest Impressionist exhibits, housed in a former rail station

name: Musée de l'Orangerie
description: Impressionist and Post-Impressionist paintings, the permanent home of eight large Water Lilies murals by Claude Monet

name: Musée Marmottan Monet
description: dedicated to Claude Monet, includes over 300 paintings including Monet's Impression, Sunrise

name: Muséum national d'histoire naturelle
description: National Museum of Natural History

name: Musée Picasso
description: dedicated to the works of Pablo Picasso

name: Musée Rodin
description: houses the works of sculptors Auguste Rodin and Camille Claudel

name: Parc de la Villette
description: hosting the Cité des Sciences et de l'Industrie, a science museum, and the Cité de la Musique, which houses various musical institutes, a museum, and a concert hall

name: Les Invalides
description: complex containing museums and monuments relating to the military history of France

name: The Panthéon
description: church and tomb of a number of France's most famed men and women

name: Place des Vosges
description: square in the Marais districte

name: Basilica of the Sacré Cœur
description: located in the district of Montmartre

name: Notre-Dame de Paris
description: Cathedral - Paris's 12th-century ecclesiastical centrepiece on the Île de la Cité

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: a 13th-century Gothic palace chapel, also located on the Île de la Cité

name: Church of St Eustache
description: a 16th-century Gothic church in the district of Les Halles

name: La Madeleine
description: a 19th-century church designed as a Roman temple

name: Grand Mosque of Paris
description: a large mosque, the first ever built in Metropolitan France

name: Arab World Institute
type: Modern and contemporary architecture of the 20th and 21st century
description: (1987) Jean Nouvel,[2] 5th arrondissement of Paris

name: Bercy Arena

name: Cité internationale universitaire de Paris

name: World Heritage Centre
type: Modern and contemporary architecture of the 20th and 21st century
description: (Unesco) (1958) architects: French Bernard Zehrfuss, Américan Marcel Breuer, and Italian Pier Luigi Nervi. Their plans were validated by an international committee of five architects: Lucio Costa (Brasil), Walter Gropius (United States), Le Corbusier (France), Sven Markelius (Sweden) and Ernesto Nathan Rogers (Italy), in collaboration with Eero Saarinen (Finland). 7th arrondissement of Paris[6]

name: Montmartre
description: an old district of Paris on a hill containing the Bateau-Lavoir, the Basilica of the Sacré Cœur, the Place du Tertre, the Musée de Montmartre, and other sites.

name: Statue of Liberty replicas
description: A smaller version of Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi's Liberty Enlightening the World, the New York City harbor statue which France gave to the United States in 1886, located on the Île aux Cygnes on the Seine in the Front de Seine district.

name: Flame of Liberty
description: replica of the flame held by the Statue of Liberty

name: Pasteur Institute
description: and museum

name: Palace of Versailles
description: the famous former palace of French kings

name: Saint Denis Basilica
description: the burial site of the French kings

name: Château de Fontainebleau
description: built by Francis I of France, it is one of the largest of the French royal châteaux

name: Château de Vincennes
description: (Vincennes Castle) - a large medieval castle nearby the Bois de Vincennes (Vincennes Wood)

name: Château Villette
description: a château built in the 18th century

name: Parc de Sceaux
description: a 17th-century park located near the Château de Sceaux (Sceaux Castle).

name: La Défense
description: The largest business district in Europe.

name: Cathédrale Saint-Maclou de Pontoise
description: Roman Catholic cathedral located in the town of Pontoise, on the outskirts of Paris.

name: Disneyland Paris
description: the largest theme park in Europe

name: Parc Astérix
description: one of many of Paris' theme parks

name: Stade de France
description: the 80,000 seater stadium in which France won the 1998 edition of the FIFA World Cup
